title: Aral Sea and Soviet control over economy

content.description:
“I belong to those scientists who consider that the drying up of the Aral Sea is far more advantageous than preserving it. First, in its zone, good fertile land will be obtained. . . . Cultivation of cotton alone will pay for the existing Aral Sea, with all its fisheries, shipping, and other industries. Second, the disappearance of the Sea will not affect the region’s landscapes.”

A. Babayev, president of Soviet Turkmenistan’s Academy of Sciences, late 1950s
content.question: Which of the following best describes the cause of the developments described in the passage?

choices.label: Soviet efforts to modernize their economy through government control
Soviet reaction to the economic crisis of the Great Depression
Protests against the environmental effects of economic development
Scientific breakthroughs in transportation and communication

content.answer: Soviet efforts to modernize their economy through government control

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Identify patterns among or connections between historical developments and processes.
